projetosHero.title: Our Projects
projetosHero.subtitle: Integrating multiple engineering fields in the aerospace sector.

sondasAeroespaciais.title: What are aerospace probes?
subtitle: Our aerospace probes are balloons filled with helium, carrying astrobiological experiments to the stratosphere, which is crucial so we can have a better understanding about how organisms can survive in space.

Although they are part of a greater scientific experiment, the probes themselves are also fascinating from the point of view of embedded systems development. Our probes are equiped with microcontrolers, radios, sensors and cameras; every mission we aim to improve our systems so we can make the next mission even more efficient.
And, to sustain all our experiments and systems, we build reliable and reusable structures, that let us go to space multiple times.

garatea1.title: Garatéa-I
experiments: Resistance testing with bacteria and fungi extracted from the Atacama desert (Chile)
embedded: Usage of */commercial modules/* in environmental parameter sensing
structure: Mechanism that can be activated to safely expose the experiments to the external environment
Structure made with */3D printing/* and */glass fiber/*

garatea2.title: Garatéa-II
experiments: Resistance testing with bacteria and fungi extracted from the Atacama desert (Chile)
embedded: Usage of */commercial modules/* in environmental parameter sensing
Usage of */solar pannels/* for battery charging
structure: Thermal insulation made with */Kapton/* and */Aeronautic Depron/*
Structure made with */3D printing/* and */glass fiber/*

garatea3.title: Garatéa-III
experiments: Co-culture of fermenting yeasts and extremophilic fungi
Culture of protozoa at different stages of life and lettuce seeds
embedded: */Data acquisition/* system developed by the group, based on Atmega328p-pu
Measuring of radiation levels with */Geiger Counter/*
structure: /*Hypercube/* structure, developed to */minimize impacts/*  and be completely */re-usable/*
Thermal insulation made with */Kapton/* and */Aeronautic Depron/*

garatea5.title: Garatéa-V
embedded: */Data acquisition/* system developed by the group, based on Atmega2560
Probe's flight altitude control through a valve in the balloon
structure: Thermal insulation made with */Kapton/* and */Aeronautic Depron/*

cubeSats.title: What are CubeSats?
subtitle: CubeSats are nanosatellites that have reduced size and weight with a very specific format. We started developing CubeSats thanks to their reduced cost of production and launching, given that it is possible to develop CubeSats with accessible electronicsand there are generic dispensers for CubeSat launching.

A CubeSat has, generally speaking, the following subsystems: the */Structural/*, */Energetic/*, */Telecommunications/*, */Control and Attitude Determination/* and */Sensing/* subsystems and a mission module. At the moment, we've been developing missions related to */Computer Vision/*.

Although we've never launched a CubeSat, every year we bring our satellites to */CubeDesign/*, a competition hosted by INPE, where our CubeSats compete for the 1st place along with other educational satellites.

zenSat.title: ZenSat
zenSat.subtitle: Our first step towards nanosatellite development and, also, the 1st place in */CubeDesign/*.
structure: ZenSat is a */2U Satellite/* with its structure made with */7075iT6 alluminum alloy/* produced with */CNC machining/* and */3D printing/*, being able to support senoidal vibrations from 0-100Hz.

uspSat.title: USPSat
uspSat.subtitle: Our opportunity to learn more and adopt a more professional approach, developing a 2U nanosatellite with optimizations made to the system and the implementation of redundancies.
structure: */2U dimension/ structure, made of */7075-T6 alluminum alloy/*, anodized in black
Usage of */carbon fiber/* plates to keep the components in place
*/Antenna deploy/* mechanism at the ends of the extreme plates

software.title: Our Software
subtitle: Although Zenith Aerospace is focused on the development of aerospace technology, we also develop tools to aid our work here on Earth.

For that, the High Level team works with languages and frameworks with high degrees of abstractions to create software that the non-programmers at Zenith are capable of using. In general, the High Level Department aims at the creation of graphical interfaces and data structures to automate and simplify Zenith's daily tasks.

reportMaker.title: Report Maker
reportMaker.detail: Software intended to automate Zenith Aerospace's report making

zenithMonitor.title: Zenith Monitor
zenithMonitor.detail: Mobile application intended to track aerospace probes in real time

zenView.title: ZenView
zenView.detail: Desktop application for dashboard creation and real-time data visualization

website.title: Zenith Website
website.detail: Zenith Aerospace's image rework through a modern website and 100% developed by us

hardware.title: Our hardware development
subtitle: We also dedicate ourselves to the development and manufacture of all the electronic components that are ambedded in our projects. Our team created */modular/* and */reusable/* hardware, besides integrating different subsystems at hardware-level.

Para desenvolver Hardware para o ambiente aeroespacial, nós enfrentamos alguns desafios. Além de incorporar os conhecimentos de */Engenharia Eletrônica/*, nós também nos preocupamos em adotar componentes que permaneçam operacionais em */ambientes hostis/*, onde há baixas temperaturas, baixas pressões e elevados índices de radiação solar.

Cada */detalhe/* dos nossos Hardwares é pensado com atenção, visando satisfazer todas as necessidades do grupo, desde pensar sobre os requisitos definidos pela missão a ser efetuada até criar arquiteturas de sistema.

educacional.title: Nossos Projetos Educacionais
subtitle: O */Garatéa-E/* nasceu do desejo do Zenith de levar a ciência para */fora da universidade/* e incentivar jovens a gostarem de pesquisar e estudar. Nosso projeto educacional traz para próximo dos alunos algo que só era visto por eles nas aulas de Física e Química, o */Espaço/*.

*/Alunos do ensino fundamental e médio/* tiveram a oportunidade de desenvolver experimentos científicos, junto com os seus professores, e mandá-los para o espaço em uma de nossas sondas aeroespaciais. Isso possibilitou que os alunos pudessem analisar as mudanças em seus experimentos após a exposição ao ambiente aeroespacial, instigando a */curiosidade/* dos estudantes.

Esta iniciativa já mobilizou milhares de estudantes em todo país nas últimas edições, trazendo resultados gratificantes aos alunos, aos professores e aos pais. Agora, o Garatéa-E possui um novo nome, */Kurumim/*, mas continua com os mesmos objetivos educacionais e, agora, planeja reunir alunos de toda a América Latina!

garateaE2017.title: Garatéa-E 2017
garateaE2017.subtitle: A primeira vez que inspiramos alunos e professores a ir além da teoria e alcançar o espaço

garateaE2018.title: Garatéa-E 2018
garateaE2018.subtitle: Nossa segunda oportunidade para apaixonar alunos entre 7 e 18 anos pela ciência e pelo espaço

garateaE2019.title: Garatéa-E 2019
garateaE2019.subtitle: Unindo alunos, professores e cientistas de todas as regiões do país no Sábado Aeroespacial pela terceira vez
